metadata.title: Guide to Analyzing and Reporting Uncertainty in Pol.is Conversations
metadata.purpose: Generate consistent, evidence-based reports identifying and explaining areas of uncertainty in voter responses

criticalInstructions.instruction: Generate a JSON response that conforms to the provided schema. DO NOT INCLUDE ANY OTHER TEXT.
DO NOT return ```json at the beginning of the response. This is not markdown. Do not end the response with ```, your response MUST begin with { and end with }

term.name: uncertainty
term.description: Comments with high pass rates (participants choose "pass" instead of agree/disagree)

term.name: high_uncertainty
term.description: Comments with very high pass rates, suggesting significant voter hesitation or confusion

step.n: Identify Comments with High Pass Rates

criticalInstructions.instruction: Focus on patterns of uncertainty, not just individual comments with high pass rates. Identify themes among uncertain comments.
Analyze what makes certain comments generate uncertainty - clarity issues, complexity, divisiveness, etc.
Compare overall uncertainty to typical Pol.is conversations (if data is available) for context.

paragraph.format:

These uncertain responses were [distribution_pattern] across the conversation, [concentration_pattern]. [Additional_high_level_context].
The highest levels of uncertainty appeared in comments addressing [topic_with_highest_uncertainty], with several statements reaching pass rates of [specific_high_percentage]% or more. These comments shared common features, including [shared_feature_1] and [shared_feature_2], suggesting that [interpretation_of_uncertainty_cause]. [Additional_insight_if_relevant].
Other significant areas of uncertainty included discussions of [secondary_uncertain_topic], particularly statements that [feature_of_uncertain_statements]. This pattern suggests that participants were [hesitant/unclear/divided] about these topics, potentially due to [proposed_reason_for_uncertainty].

paragraphInstructions.instruction: Provide a comprehensive overview that: - Quantifies the overall level of uncertainty - Identifies main areas/topics generating uncertainty - Analyzes patterns in uncertain comments - Proposes potential reasons for observed uncertainty - Supports all claims with appropriate citations

criticalInstructions.instruction: For comments with high uncertainty, analyze specific features that might cause hesitation - ambiguous language, complex concepts, contentious topics, etc.
Consider group-specific patterns of uncertainty - do certain groups show more hesitation on particular topics?
Differentiate between different causes of uncertainty rather than assuming a single explanation for all high-pass comments.

paragraph.format:
Closer examination revealed several distinct causes of uncertainty in this conversation. One significant factor was [primary_cause_of_uncertainty], particularly evident in comments about [specific_topic]. These statements often [feature_of_uncertain_comments], leading participants to [reason_for_passing]. This pattern was especially pronounced in [specific_example_with_citation].
A second factor contributing to uncertainty was [secondary_cause_of_uncertainty], which affected comments addressing [another_topic]. These comments typically [different_feature_of_uncertain_comments], creating a situation where participants may have [another_reason_for_passing]. For example, [specific_example_with_citation] demonstrated this pattern clearly.
[If group differences exist] Notably, uncertainty patterns varied across participant groups. Group [X] showed markedly [higher/lower] pass rates on statements about [topic_with_group_difference], suggesting that [interpretation_of_group_difference]. Meanwhile, Group [Y] demonstrated unique uncertainty regarding [group_specific_uncertainty_topic], potentially indicating [interpretation_of_group_specific_pattern].
[If relevant] The relationship between uncertainty and agreement/disagreement revealed that [pattern_between_uncertainty_and_polarization]. Comments generating both high uncertainty and significant disagreement often addressed [contentious_uncertain_topics], suggesting that participant hesitation stemmed from [interpretation_of_contentious_uncertainty].

paragraphInstructions.instruction: For each identified pattern of uncertainty: - Provide specific examples with appropriate citations - Analyze the linguistic or conceptual features causing hesitation - Consider group-specific patterns where relevant - Connect to broader conversation themes - Offer evidence-based interpretations of underlying causes

paragraph.length: 3-6 paragraphs, depending on complexity of uncertainty patterns

case.description: When one group shows much higher uncertainty than others on specific topics

validationRules.rule: All claims about uncertainty must be based on pass rate data
Each claim requires at least one citation
Multiple causes of uncertainty must be considered
